ygData.subject: google v. heritrix comparison
ygData.msgSnippet: After doing some manual link analysis on google, using link:www.exploratorium.edu/... , we discovered that many of the pages generated by the 1,000 pages/host

After doing some manual link analysis on google, 
using "link:www.exploratorium.edu/...", we discovered that many of 
the pages generated by the 1,000 pages/host on google are unreachable 
even though they are within the host.  We found two 
main points to support this:

1.  URLs that are outside of the host that link to the host 
Igor wrote a script that queries google using the "link:www..." 
feature and finds all the pages that are not reachable through the 
host.  In other words, it finds those pages that are not linked to 
within the host, but are only linked from outside of the host.  For 
host "www.exploratorium.edu", we found that this number amounted to 
about 10% of the pages that google had but heritrix did not.

2.  Outdated google links-database
For example, when we 
entered "link:www.exploratorium.edu/pr/candy.html" in the google 
search field, we got "www.exploratorium.edu/pr/" as one of the 
results.  But when we actually searched for "candy.html" on 
the "www.exploratorium.edu/pr/" page it was no where to be found.  
Even the cached version of the /pr/ page did not contain the link.  
This occurred with other pages we searched for as well, not 
only "candy.html".  Finally, by doing a search on the complete cdx 
files, we found that "www.exploratorium.edu/pr/" actually did link 
to "candy.html", but that was back in April.  The google link search 
was returning outdated results that were relevant to a few months 
ago, while the resulting page had already changed.  It seems that 
candy.html, as well as many other pages from the 1,000 pgs/host 
google search, are unreachable through the host.

Therefore, heritrix is probably doing better than the reports 
indicate, as many of the URLs that heritrix did not find are not 
linked from the host.


Judy
